plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

122624.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Layout Lab
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with automated layout perfection. This powerful plugin streamlines your design process by intelligently handling spacing, alignment, and organization – saving you valuable time while ensuring pixel-perfect results.


🎯 Key Features:

  1. Auto-Layout: Instantly structure frames and elements with intelligent automation
  2. Perfect Spacing: Apply consistent spacing between elements with a single click
  3. Smart Grouping: Organize similar frames and elements into clean, logical layouts
  4. Nested Layer Support: Apply consistent spacing across all layer depths
  5. Customizable Settings: Fine-tune spacing, gaps, and layout modes to match your needs


💪 Perfect For:

  1. UI/UX Designers creating complex interfaces
  2. Design teams maintaining consistency across projects
  3. Product designers working on component libraries
  4. Anyone looking to speed up their layout workflow


🚀 How It Works:

  1. Select the elements you want to organize
  2. Choose your preferred layout settings
  3. Let the plugin work its magic!


✨ Benefits:

  1. Save hours on manual layout adjustments
  2. Maintain consistent spacing throughout your designs
  3. Reduce time spent on repetitive tasks
  4. Create more professional, polished layouts
  5. Ensure design system compliance


🎨 Supported Features:

  1. Auto-spacing calculation
  2. Intelligent grouping
  3. Responsive layouts
  4. Multi-selection support
  5. Custom spacing presets
  6. Quick actions


Made with ❤️ by a designer for designers. We're constantly improving – your feedback helps make this plugin better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Automate your design workflow with perfect spacing, smart grouping, and pixel-perfect layouts

115633.release_notes:
I'm excited to announce the latest updates to the Layout Lab Plugin! Here’s what’s new:

🚀 New Features:
Rectangles Added to Defined Node: Rectangles are now recognized as valid nodes and included in the auto-layout system.

🛠 Enhancements:
Horizontal Layout Improvements: Enhanced grouping of frames with similar Y positions (within a 3-pixel tolerance) into horizontal rows for better alignment.

📝 How to Use:
Rectangles: Select rectangles with other nodes and run the plugin.
Horizontal Layout: Select frames with similar Y positions for automatic grouping.

Thank you for using the Layout Lab Plugin! 🎨
115633.tagline: Automate your design workflow with perfect spacing, smart grouping, and pixel-perfect layouts

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

•Font size

•Font weight

•Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents—but does not apply—the following properties:

•Line height

•Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 ÷ 100 × 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

•Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

•Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

•text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

135683.name: Text Styles to Variables
135683.description:

Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

plugins.name: flowwwww
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflows with flowwwww, the ultimate plugin for creating dynamic connectors between frames, components, and other objects in Figma. Whether you're designing user flows, wireframes, or complex diagrams, flowwwwwempowers you to create professional, customizable connections with ease.


Key Features

Intuitive Connector Creation

Select two frames or components, and flowwwww will instantly generate a connector between them.


Highly Customizable

Personalize your connectors with adjustable properties:

Stroke color and size.

Add text annotations to label your connectors for enhanced clarity.


Smart Obstacle Avoidance

Enable Obstacle Mode to automatically detect and avoid overlapping objects, ensuring clean and unobstructed connectors.

Perfect for complex designs where connectors need to navigate around other elements.



Use Cases

User Flows : Map out user journeys with clear, annotated connectors between screens.

Wireframing : Create structured layouts with precise connections between components.

Technical Diagrams : Build flowcharts, process maps, and other technical illustrations with ease.

Prototyping : Enhance your prototypes with interactive and visually appealing connectors.


How It Works

Install the flowwwww plugin from the Figma Community.

Select two frames, components, or rectangles that you want to connect.


Configure your connector settings (color, style, etc.) via the plugin interface.


Let flowwwww do the rest—watch as it creates beautiful, dynamic connectors that adapt to your design.


Why Choose flowwwww?

flowwwww is more than just a connector tool—it’s a productivity booster for designers who value precision, flexibility, and efficiency. With its robust feature set and seamless integration into Figma, flowwwww is the go-to solution for anyone looking to elevate their design workflow.


Feedback and Support

We’re committed to making flowwwww the best it can be! If you have any suggestions, encounter issues, or simply love the plugin, we’d love to hear from you. Leave a comment on the Figma Community page or reach out to us directly.


Get Started Today

Install flowwwww now and experience the power of effortless connector creation. Simplify your design process and bring your ideas to life with clarity and precision.
plugins.tagline: Effortless Connector Creation for Figma

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

accepted.name: dano
accepted.description: i do design and design activities

plugins.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
plugins.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.
plugins.tagline: Generate variables from color and text combinations.

89740.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
89740.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.
89740.release_notes:
1. We have changed the plugin name.
2. We have changed the plugin cover image.
89740.tagline: Generate variables from color and text combinations.

plugins.name: Design-to-JSON
plugins.description:
Design to JSON: A Developer's Bridge


Supercharge your design-to-development workflow with Design to JSON. This plugin inspects your selected Figma layers and recursively exports the entire hierarchy into a clean, structured, and developer-friendly JSON format. Stop manually transcribing design specs and start automating your UI development.


Who Is It For?

This plugin is built primarily for Frontend Developers and UI Engineers who need to translate Figma designs into pixel-perfect code. It's also a powerful tool for Design System Maintainers and anyone looking to automate asset extraction or design analysis.


Key Features:

•Recursive Tree Traversal: It doesn't just scan the top layer. The plugin dives deep into all nested frames, groups, and components to give you a complete hierarchical view.

•Absolute Coordinates for Layout: Outputs the global coordinates and dimensions (absoluteRenderBounds) for every element, which is exactly what you need for CSS positioning, eliminating guesswork with relative positions.

•Comprehensive Property Extraction: Captures a wide range of properties crucial for development:

oGeometry: Position, size, rotation.

oStyling: Fills, strokes, and effects with RGBA color values (0-255).

oTypography: Font family, style, size, line height, letter spacing, and alignment.

oAuto Layout: Direction, padding, and item spacing.

oComponent Info: Details about instances and their main components.

•Simple & Clean UI: A straightforward interface to generate and copy the JSON with a single click.


How to Use:

1.Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas.

2.Run the "Design to JSON" plugin.

3.Click the "Generate JSON" button.

4.The JSON output will appear in the text area.

5.Click "Copy to Clipboard" to grab the data and use it in your code.


Best Practices for Your Design File:

To get the most accurate and useful JSON, it's recommended to follow these design practices:

•Name Your Layers: Use descriptive layer names (e.g., "SubmitButton" instead of "Rectangle 128"). These names appear directly in the JSON, making it much more readable.

•Embrace Auto Layout: The plugin is built to understand Auto Layout. Using it for components, buttons, and layouts will provide rich data (padding, spacing, direction) that is directly translatable to Flexbox or similar CSS models.

•Use Components: Structuring your design with components helps maintain a clean hierarchy, which will be reflected in the JSON output. The plugin captures instance information.

•Avoid Unnecessary Grouping: Whenever possible, use Frames with Auto Layout instead of nested groups (Group > Group > Element). This results in a cleaner and more semantic JSON structure.


Limitations & Caveats:

•Mixed Styles in Text: While the plugin recursively finds the properties of individual elements, if a single text node contains multiple styles (e.g., different fonts or colors applied to different words), the Figma API provides summary data. The plugin will note this but cannot separate the mixed styles within that single element.

•Complex Vector Data: This plugin focuses on properties relevant for UI layout and styling. It does not export the raw path data (<path d="...">) of complex vector networks or boolean operations.

•API Boundaries: The plugin can only extract data that is exposed by the official Figma Plugin API.


Support the Developer

This plugin is developed and maintained with love. If you find it useful and it saves you time, you can say thanks by supporting its future development. Every bit of support is hugely appreciated!

•✨ BTC: bc1q9ye90fd5xe62srglv84hjktwdggtkzf4xttn7h
plugins.tagline: Compose your design into JSON describing all the elements - easy to translate into the webpage

137484.name: Design-to-JSON
137484.description:
Design to JSON: A Developer's Bridge


Supercharge your design-to-development workflow with Design to JSON. This plugin inspects your selected Figma layers and recursively exports the entire hierarchy into a clean, structured, and developer-friendly JSON format. Stop manually transcribing design specs and start automating your UI development.


Who Is It For?

This plugin is built primarily for Frontend Developers and UI Engineers who need to translate Figma designs into pixel-perfect code. It's also a powerful tool for Design System Maintainers and anyone looking to automate asset extraction or design analysis.


Key Features:

•Recursive Tree Traversal: It doesn't just scan the top layer. The plugin dives deep into all nested frames, groups, and components to give you a complete hierarchical view.

•Absolute Coordinates for Layout: Outputs the global coordinates and dimensions (absoluteRenderBounds) for every element, which is exactly what you need for CSS positioning, eliminating guesswork with relative positions.

•Comprehensive Property Extraction: Captures a wide range of properties crucial for development:

oGeometry: Position, size, rotation.

oStyling: Fills, strokes, and effects with RGBA color values (0-255).

oTypography: Font family, style, size, line height, letter spacing, and alignment.

oAuto Layout: Direction, padding, and item spacing.

oComponent Info: Details about instances and their main components.

•Simple & Clean UI: A straightforward interface to generate and copy the JSON with a single click.


How to Use:

1.Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas.

2.Run the "Design to JSON" plugin.

3.Click the "Generate JSON" button.

4.The JSON output will appear in the text area.

5.Click "Copy to Clipboard" to grab the data and use it in your code.


Best Practices for Your Design File:

To get the most accurate and useful JSON, it's recommended to follow these design practices:

•Name Your Layers: Use descriptive layer names (e.g., "SubmitButton" instead of "Rectangle 128"). These names appear directly in the JSON, making it much more readable.

•Embrace Auto Layout: The plugin is built to understand Auto Layout. Using it for components, buttons, and layouts will provide rich data (padding, spacing, direction) that is directly translatable to Flexbox or similar CSS models.

•Use Components: Structuring your design with components helps maintain a clean hierarchy, which will be reflected in the JSON output. The plugin captures instance information.

•Avoid Unnecessary Grouping: Whenever possible, use Frames with Auto Layout instead of nested groups (Group > Group > Element). This results in a cleaner and more semantic JSON structure.


Limitations & Caveats:

•Mixed Styles in Text: While the plugin recursively finds the properties of individual elements, if a single text node contains multiple styles (e.g., different fonts or colors applied to different words), the Figma API provides summary data. The plugin will note this but cannot separate the mixed styles within that single element.

•Complex Vector Data: This plugin focuses on properties relevant for UI layout and styling. It does not export the raw path data (<path d="...">) of complex vector networks or boolean operations.

•API Boundaries: The plugin can only extract data that is exposed by the official Figma Plugin API.


Support the Developer

This plugin is developed and maintained with love. If you find it useful and it saves you time, you can say thanks by supporting its future development. Every bit of support is hugely appreciated!

plugins.name: BlendAI
plugins.description:
BlendAI seamlessly integrates with Figma to let you generate high-quality images from text prompts or combine up to three reference images in a single click. It’s perfect for product mockups, hero banners, packshots, concept art, backgrounds, or quick visual inspiration—without ever leaving your Figma file.


Key Features:

• Simple prompt → image

Type a natural-language description and instantly receive a crisp, AI-rendered result.

• Multi-reference blending

Upload up to three reference images (for example: a product shot, a texture, and a background) and instruct BlendAI to place, style, or combine them.

Example: “Place @IMG_1 in front of @IMG_2 with the lighting mood of @IMG_3.”

• Six aspect-ratio presets

1:1 (Square), 16:9 (Landscape), 9:16 (Portrait), 4:3 (Classic), 3:4 (Portrait), 21:9 (Ultrawide)

• Instant one-click generation

No manual exports or workarounds—everything happens directly in Figma’s interface.

• Credit-based system

Includes a free 10-image starter pack. Easily top up credits from the “Get More” menu.

• History & quick re-use

View, revisit, and re-generate past images directly within the plugin.


BlendAI was built for designers who need on-the-fly visuals—whether it’s a quick hero image for a mockup, a polished packshot for a product page, or a fully blended scene combining multiple photo references. Try it free, then unlock larger credit packs for heavy usage.
plugins.tagline: AI image generation & multi-reference blending inside Figma for hero banners, mockups or backgrounds

plugins.name: Padding Check
plugins.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? This plugin solves this problem of yours where you can quickly identify the Figma frames with the said padding issues. The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.
plugins.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

134144.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

plugins.name: Ting-Image
plugins.description:
Ting Image—One-click compression, instant format conversion. Switch between PNG, JPEG, WEBP, AVIF for smaller, optimized images. Efficiency meets ease!

1. Efficient Compression

Advanced algorithms reduce image size while preserving quality, saving storage and speeding up load times.

2. Multi-Format Conversion

Instantly switch between PNG, JPEG, WEBP, and AVIF formats to fit any design or development need.

3. Batch Processing

Process multiple images at once to save time and boost productivity.

4. Smart Preview

Real-time previews let you compare and control compression quality effortlessly.

5. Seamless Integration

Works directly within Figma, keeping your design workflow smooth and uninterrupted.

6. Lightweight & Stable

Runs efficiently without slowing down Figma, ensuring a seamless experience.


Thank you for your support

@Wiley Shaw @v-huanghaolan

plugins.name: BANCONE
plugins.description: BANCONE is a Software-as-a-Service platform powered by an integrated suite of AI-driven tools that simplify, optimize, and improve the quality of Human-Machine Interaction (HMI) design and development. Initially focused on the automotive sector, specifically software-defined vehicles, the platform is designed to expand to other industrial domains in the future. BANCONE transforms how automotive teams create and implement sophisticated cockpit interfaces, leveraging artificial intelligence to automate routine tasks, detect issues early, and generate innovative design solutions.

plugins.name: Set Gradient Style
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"

plugins.name: C2O - Clutter to Organised
plugins.description:
C2O (Clutter to Organized) is a simple and effective Figma plugin that helps designers automatically arrange frames into a structured layout. If your Figma file feels cluttered, C2O will neatly organize everything in just one click.


✨ How It Works:

1️⃣ Rename your frames with a prefix inside square brackets.

Example:

[1a] Login Page (Row 1, Frame A)

[1b] Password Entry (Row 1, Frame B)

[2a] Dashboard (Row 2, Frame A)

2️⃣ Run the plugin and click "Organize Frames".

3️⃣ Your frames will be arranged into clearly structured groups, placed in order from top to bottom.

Frames without the naming pattern will be placed in an "Others" group at the bottom.


💡 Why Use C2O?

Eliminates manual alignment work and saves time.

Keeps designs structured and easy to navigate.

Improves team collaboration by maintaining a clean layout.

Click “Try it out” and bring order to your Figma files effortlessly! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Structure your Figma frames in One Click!

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

🇦🇿 Azerbaijani, 🇺🇸 English (USA), 🇩🇪 German, 🇰🇿 Kazakh, 🇰🇬 Kyrgyz, 🇷🇺 Russian, 🇹🇷 Turkish, 🇹🇲 Turkmen, 🇺🇦 Ukrainian, 🇺🇿 Uzbek


Available data types:

🎲 Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

👫🏻 Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

🤪 Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

📞 Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

💳 Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

⭐️ Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

📆 Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

📆 Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

📆 Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

💼 Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

🎨 Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you’re designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


✦ Lightning-fast generation

✦ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

✦ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

✦ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace “lorem ipsum” forever — grow your designs with Data Bloom.


🌱 How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click “Generate Data” and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

accepted.name: Five Eight Bloom
accepted.description:
Exploring usability, interaction, and aesthetics to craft intuitive digital experiences. 

Sharing design files, prototypes, and experiments 🚀

plugins.tagline: Replace dummy text with real-world localized content (🇦🇿 🇺🇸 🇰🇿 🇰🇬 🇹🇷 🇹🇲 🇺🇿 +3)

137709.name: Data Bloom
137709.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

🇦🇿 Azerbaijani, 🇺🇸 English (USA), 🇩🇪 German, 🇰🇿 Kazakh, 🇰🇬 Kyrgyz, 🇷🇺 Russian, 🇹🇷 Turkish, 🇹🇲 Turkmen, 🇺🇦 Ukrainian, 🇺🇿 Uzbek


Available data types:

🎲 Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

👫🏻 Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

🤪 Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

📞 Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

💳 Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

⭐️ Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

📆 Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

📆 Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

📆 Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

💼 Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

🎨 Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you’re designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


✦ Lightning-fast generation

✦ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

✦ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

✦ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace “lorem ipsum” forever — grow your designs with Data Bloom.


🌱 How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click “Generate Data” and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.
137709.release_notes: - Date options have been consolidated for a cleaner menu
137709.tagline: Replace dummy text with real-world localized content (🇦🇿 🇺🇸 🇰🇿 🇰🇬 🇹🇷 🇹🇲 🇺🇿 +3)

plugins.name: Translate Text with Gemini
plugins.description:
Translate Text with Gemini is a powerful yet lightweight Figma plugin that helps you quickly translate any selected text nodes into over 30 languages using Google’s Gemini AI.


✨ Key Features:

•Supports App Store Connect languages (e.g. French, Japanese, Arabic, Vietnamese, etc.)

•Smart deduplication — identical phrases are only translated once

•Structured output parsing to ensure accurate mapping

•Custom language support beyond the dropdown list

•Built for speed and scale (bulk translate entire Frames/Sections)


🔒 Your API key is safely stored per session.


Created with ❤️ by Giang Nguyen.
plugins.tagline: Effortless multilingual translation for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Update FigJam Colors
plugins.description:
A small utility plugin to automatically update your FigJam stickies, shapes, sections and connectors to the new colors released on Feb 4 2025.


Instructions

  1. open the page where you want to update colors
  2. run plugin via the Action Menu ( ⌘+P, CTRL + P)
  3. see new colors!


Feedback & Support

  1. @actuallyakbar on Twitter
  2. github.com/akbarbmirza
plugins.tagline: Automatically update your FigJam stickies, shapes, sections and connectors to the new FigJam colors

plugins.name: Variable Color Recommender
plugins.description: Ensure color consistency across your design system with ease. This plugin detects colors in text and design elements that aren’t part of your variables library and suggests the closest matching colors based on precise RGB calculations. Version 1.0 supports fills for text and design elements but does not include stroke colors. Stroke support will be added in Version 2.0.
plugins.tagline: Select an element, get the closest matching variable from your design system.
